intro: Myoxanthus parvilabius, commonly known as the small-lipped myoxanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems. Myoxanthus parvilabius is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and rocky slopes.
